Posts.Content: Dec 31, 2013 12:40PM Sunshower wrote: Hi everyone! I just joined this thread and breastcancer.org. I had a bilateral mastectomy on December 6th. I was nursing my 18 month old daughter at the time I was diagnosed, so there was only a month between when I weaned her cold turkey and went in for surgery. When I went in for my consultation with my plastic surgeon, he declined to perform the immediate reconstruction because he was concerned about the risk of Â infection from residual breast milk that would create an unsterile environment. Â I was devastated and couldn't keep myself from breaking down and crying in the doctors office. Â Although it's been hard to have my reconstruction put off. The bra with prosthetic inserts aren't as bad as I expected. A friend of mine who had to have one of her TE removed because of infection also wore a bra with a prosthetic for a few months until the infection resolved. So, Bobogirl, I'm so sorry for everything you are going through. Any setback is always a heart break. I hope things work out for you.
Posts.Title: December 2013 surgeries bobogirl sandra4611

Posts.Content: Dec 31, 2013 05:20PM Sunshower wrote: Thank you Sam2u and warrior_woman...My recovery is going well. My oncologist is recommending Chemo and Tamoxofin. I understand the recommendation for the chemo since I'm young (36 y/o) and my oncotype score came back at 32 (high recurrence risk) but my er/pr status was only weakly positive (20%). With all the side effects of anti-hormone therapy, I'm not sure the benefit/risk is worthwhile. I have an appointment for a second opinion at Moffitt cancer hospital in Tampa on 1/15. I'll decide for sure after that. Sam2U...I'm sure you are beautiful, lopsided or not...Warrior_woman...I love the name. Very powerfulğŸ’ª
Posts.Title: December 2013 surgeries bobogirl sandra4611

Posts.Content: Jan 21, 2014 07:14AM Sunshower wrote: hi ladies! This is my first post to this thread. I start my first TC treatment this Friday. I'm set to do 4 rounds 3 weeks apart, then tamoxifen for 5 years. My oncologist sent me for a second opinion last week. I think he wanted me to feel comfortable with his recommendations. Although it's a stage 1a cancer (on the threshold of a stage 2 at 2cm/ 1.5/ 1.5). I'm 37y/o and my oncotype score came back a 32. It a high recurrence risk. 21% with tamoxifen and cut to 14% with chemo added. The 2nd opinion MO actually recommended dense dose with TCA for an extra month. He said i could go that route if I wanted to go all out, but my local MO thought that it was unnecessary and we were being aggressive enough in treatment. Since there is no data to suggest a benefit of one over the other for 1a cancers, I decided to forego the extra risk and go with my local MO's recommendation. Has any one else come across this?

Posts.Content: Feb 4, 2014 08:49AM Sunshower wrote: I just finished 5 days of Neupogen shots on Sunday. Even with taking the Claritin the whole week I had awful back pain especially the past 3 days. I took Advil Sunday, but the doc is gonna call in a prescription for Celebrex instead since that won't affect my platelets. Also, I got my blood work yesterday and my WBC count was down to 1.78 and my neutrophil % was 29.30 and granulocytes were 0.522, which showed up LL when compared with normal. Does anyone know at what point you are considered neutropenic?
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo January 6, 2014 desimone birdlover23

Posts.Content: Feb 7, 2014 04:57PM Sunshower wrote: curlyq- Hope you are feeling better and you don't need to go to the hospital. I tried the Claritin with my Neupagen shot and I still got pretty bad back pain for about 3 days. My doctor gave me a prescription for Celebrex for the pain. Oxycodone should be just as good. I wonder why they choose one or the other... Marren- I've heard good things about the glutamine. I haven't had any peripheral neuropathy so far so I haven't used it. Diamond lil- hope you have a great weekend and enjoy that walk on the beach! It's winter in Florida, but we get some good beach weather too. Hopefully it will warm up this weekend. So...I am 10 days post my first chemo and just got my period. I was expecting chemopause, so I'm a little surprised. Otherwise, I feel pretty good. I'm glad we get a little recoup time before getting knocked on out butts again. I just have some minimal hair shedding but am gonna shave it once it starts coming out in clumps. I'm enjoying my pixie cut in the meantime.Â

Posts.Content: Jan 30, 2014 08:16AM - edited Jan 30, 2014 08:17AM by Sunshower katigrey - beautiful picture with you and your son. Â  Asb- great pics...so important for us to document the stages we go through. The wig is very flatteringğŸ’ Myra-Â glad to hear you finally got those awful drains out and the medical marijuana is working for you...it's illegal in Florida too, but fortunately the meds they are giving have been helping with SE's so far. Mor- I've been setting alarms on my iPhone cause I'm definitely a little foggier with chemo. I don't know what meds you've been prescribed but this is my schedule for week of Chemo starting with the the day before:Â  Day 0 (before): Claritin x 1 in a.m. Â  Â  Â  Â  Â Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â Steroid x 2 in am and pm Â  Â  Day 1 (chemo day): Claritin x1 in am Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â Steroid x 2 in am and pm Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â Zofran x 1 b/f dinner Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â Compazine x 1 b/f bed Day 2: Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Claritin x 1 in am Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Zofran x1 b/f breakfast Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Steroid x2 in am and pm Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Zofran x 1 b/f dinner Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â Compazine x 1 b/f bed Day 3, 4 and 5: Â Claritin x 1 in am Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Zofran and/ or Compazine as neeed. This is what is working for me so far....you could probably do one for yourself to get a good visual Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â

Posts.Content: Feb 9, 2014 07:04AM Sunshower wrote: I wasn't put on any diet restrictions either...My MO just said to make sure I was eating enough protein since it helps your body heal and renew healthy cells. I think the concern with fresh fruits and veggies is there is an risk of contamination, but I have continued to eat fresh fruits and veggies. I clean them really well with vinegar or a veggie cleaner spray. I also am avoiding salad bars or getting salads out since who know how they prepared it and how clean they are. Â
